content.webTitle: Paratrooper dies of wounds in Helmand operation

fields.headline: Paratrooper dies of wounds in Helmand operation
fields.bodyText: A soldier serving with the 3rd Battalion, the Parachute Regiment, has been killed in Afghanistan; he is yet to be named, though his family have been informed. A spokesman for Task Force Helmand said the man had been part of an operation in Nad-e Ali district when hit, and died of his wounds: "He made the ultimate sacrifice protecting the people of Nad-e Ali from insurgent intimidation and defending his country from the threat of terrorism; no more could be asked of any soldier. He will be greatly missed by all who knew him." A total of 346 UK soldiers have died in Afghanistan since 2001.
